metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5424 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
PostgreSQL before 9.1.23, 9.2.x before 9.2.18, 9.3.x before 9.3.14, 9.4.xbefore 9.4.9, and 9.5.x before 9.5.4 might allow remote authenticated userswith the CREATEDB or CREATEROLE role to gain superuser privileges via a (1)" (double quote), (2) \ (backslash), (3) carriage return, or (4) newlinecharacter in a (a) database or (b) role name that is mishandled during anadministrative operation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5424` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
libecpg6 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpgtypes3 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
libpq5 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-9.5 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-client-9.5 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-contrib-9.5 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plperl-9.5 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython-9.5 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-plpython3-9.5 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
postgresql-pltcl-9.5 - 9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.5.4-0ubuntu0.16.04').
